CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 16, 1966, pg. 1B reads: "The Squaws - one of the city's most popular social groups, the Pittsburgh Chapter of Squaws, Inc., is noted for presenting two swank holiday fetes. One is held during the Christmas season, and the other on the Fourth of July weekend.  Their last affair, a smart dinner-dance, was held at the Holiday House.  The Squaws were easily identified by their pretty white frocks and long silver plump headpiece.  Seated left to right: Mmes. Leslie Shelton, Gerald H. Tames, Charles Matthews, Cecelia Jones, James R. Shelton, John C. Hairston, and Chester C. Chavis, president.  Standing from left: Mmes. Fred Montgomery, Curtis Watkins, Mark Sloan Jr., William Stewart, Roosevelt Giddens, Calvin Nelson, Farleigh Bagley, Henry Primas Jr. and Alma Davis."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Squaws members, from left, seated: Mrs. Leslie Shelton, Mrs. Gerald H. Tames, Mrs. Charles Matthews, Cecelia Jones, Mrs. James R. Shelton, Mrs. John C. Hairston, and Mrs. Chester C. Chavis; standing: Mrs. Fred Montgomery, Mrs. Curtis Watkins, Mrs. Mark Sloan Jr., Mrs. William Stewart, Mrs. Roosevelt Giddens, Mrs. Calvin Nelson, Mrs. Farleigh Bagley, Mrs. Henry Primas Jr., and Alma Davis, posed in the Holiday House for Squaws "Cotton Extravaganza"  Dinner-Dance, Monroeville
